proof:
Proof. Let $C_1, \dots, C_k$ be components of $(V_H, E_H \setminus E')$ and wlog $C_1$ is the component of the highest total degree.
$\mathrm{deg}_H(C_1) \ge \frac{1}{2} \mathrm{deg}_H(V_H)$. Then it follows $\mathrm{deg}_H(C_2 \cup \dots \cup C_k) \le \mathrm{deg}_H(V_H)/2$, and thus we can use the third expansion property to get
$$|E'| \ge \alpha \mathrm{deg}_H(C_2 \cup \dots \cup C_k) = \alpha(\mathrm{deg}_H(V_H) - \mathrm{deg}_H(C_1))$$
This gives $\mathrm{deg}_H(C_1) \ge \mathrm{deg}_H(V_H) - |E'|/\alpha \ge (1 - \frac{2\theta}{\alpha}) \mathrm{deg}_H(V_H)$.
